SourcedStatement: A Southwest spokesperson told The Oaklandside that the assertion that any Oakland employee was forced to work while sick or take unpaid absences is unfounded.
Name: Southwest Airlines
Justification: Southwest Airlines is the defendant in the lawsuit and its spokesperson provides the company's official response to the allegations.

SourcedStatement: “Southwest Airlines fully complies with applicable sick leave laws in Oakland and California, as well as with the terms of a December 2020 settlement agreement with the city,” the spokesperson said in a statement.
Name: Southwest Airlines
Justification: Southwest Airlines reiterates its compliance with laws and the settlement agreement in response to the lawsuit.

SourcedStatement: Some of the newer complaints from Southwest workers were filed with Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards, which enforces wage and hour laws in the city.
Name: Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards
Justification: The Department of Workforce Employment Standards is the city agency responsible for handling complaints related to wage and hour laws.

SourcedStatement: “The City of Oakland is committed to protecting workers by ensuring that all employers in Oakland are complying with laws that protect their rights,” Parker said in a statement.
Name: Barbara Parker
Title: City Attorney
Justification: Barbara Parker, as the City Attorney, is responsible for enforcing labor laws in Oakland and is the primary figure in the lawsuit against Southwest Airlines.

SourcedStatement: “We are grateful that the City of Oakland is holding Southwest accountable. Name: Eric Swygert
Title: Elected Ramp Representative
Justification: Eric Swygert, as a Southwest employee and union representative, provides insight into the workers' perspective on the lawsuit.

Justification: The lawsuit filed in Alameda County Superior Court is the basis for the allegations against Southwest Airlines.
